gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem

Class Predication

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.AbstractRelation
      • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.Predication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasPredicate, Relation, SemanticItem, java.lang.Comparable<SemanticItem>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Conjunction

    public class Predication
extends AbstractRelation
implements HasPredicate
    A generalized predicate-argument structure. In addition to all elements that pertain to an Event objects, a predication includes scalar modality values and a source, as described in Kilicoglu (2012).

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • setDefaultScalarValues

        public void setDefaultScalarValues()
        Initializes the scales for this predication.

        This creates an EPISTEMIC scale for the predication and assigns it the value of 1.0, i.e., every predication is initially a FACT.

      • addScalarValue

        Parameters:

        i - the value

      • getSpan

        public SpanList getSpan()
        Gets the span covered by this predication.

        This corresponds to the union of the predicate span and the spans of the arguments.

        Specified by:
        getSpan in interface SemanticItem
        Overrides:
        getSpan in class AbstractRelation
        Returns:
        the predication span

      • setDefaultSources

        public void setDefaultSources()
        Initializes the source for this predication.

        This assigns WRITER as the source for the predication.

      • hasGenericSource

        public boolean hasGenericSource()
        Returns:
        true if the source of this predication is GENERIC.

      • hasDefaultSource

        public boolean hasDefaultSource()
        Returns:
        true if the source is WRITER.

      • setSource

        public void setSource(boolean createGeneric)
        Sets the source of this predication, if the predicate is an epistemic scalar predicate.

        It first determines whether the predication has a GENERIC source (e.g., It is suggested that...). Otherwise, it uses arguments with the SUBJ role to identify the source. If this does not yield a source and if GENERIC source is allowed (createGeneric), it tries to use dependency relations to identify the source.

        Parameters:
        createGeneric - whether GENERIC source is allowed
